entry.title: Santa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Santa opened the 2024 Summer Paralympics closing ceremony (pictured)?

entry.title: tempered (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that researchers speculate that cocoa butter forms crystals on sugar while chocolate is tempered?

entry.title: noken system (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the noken system used for voting in parts of Indonesia can produce turnouts of 100%?

entry.title: Tonya Burns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that for 19 years Tonya Burns had the only retired jersey number in Iowa State women's basketball history?

entry.title: ninety-two railway stations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Northamptonshire has had ninety-two railway stations, but now has only six?

entry.title: Joe Wirkkunen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Joe Wirkkunen coached the Finland men's national ice hockey team after receiving a recommendation from Canada?

entry.title: ...Well, Better Than the Alternative (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the music video for "...Well, Better Than the Alternative" uses software to render handmade paintings over live-action footage of musician Will Wood?

entry.title: Henry Firth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British conscientious objector Henry Firth died in 1918 while being held at a work camp in Dartmoor?

entry.title: Eniaios (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the ongoing premiere of Gregory Markopoulos's Eniaios started 20 years ago?
